intro: Calycostemma, commonly known as the "California goldenbush," is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. It is native to California and thrives in dry, rocky soils, often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive, spicy scent when crushed. Calycostemma is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
